summary: This is an email chain from August 10, 2019, regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It includes an official statement from the Department of Justice's Office of Public Affairs announcing that Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in an apparent suicide and was later pronounced dead at a hospital.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He is the sender and recipient of emails inquiring about the Attorney General's statement and FBI presence regarding Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The document announces his death by apparent suicide in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center while awaiting trial for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, was the lead prosecutor overseeing the criminal case against Epstein.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at approximately 6:30 a.m. from an apparent suicide. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead.

events.title: Epstein's Arrival at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:30 a.m., in an apparent suicide.
Epstein was transported to a local hospital and pronounced dead by hospital staff.
The FBI is investigating the incident.
Epstein had arrived at MCC New York on July 6, 2019, under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.
The email chain shows U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman seeking information about the Attorney General's statement and FBI presence on the scene shortly after the death was announced.
